distribution_descriptions.normal: Symmetric bell curve. Used for heights, weights, measurement errors.
distribution_descriptions.lognormal: Right-skewed distribution. Used for income, stock prices, positive data.
distribution_descriptions.gamma: Flexible shape for waiting times and rainfall amounts.
distribution_descriptions.beta: Bounded distribution on [0,1]. Used for probabilities and rates.
distribution_descriptions.studentt: Heavy-tailed alternative to normal. Used for small samples.
distribution_descriptions.gumbel: Extreme value distribution for maximum events.

gof_tests.title: Goodness-of-Fit Test Results
gof_tests.all_passed: All tests PASSED: The fitted distribution is consistent with the data.
gof_tests.ks_pass: The fitted distribution is consistent with the observed data (fail to reject H0).
gof_tests.ks_weak: Weak evidence against the fitted distribution (reject H0 at α=0.05).
gof_tests.ks_strong: Strong evidence against the fitted distribution (reject H0 at α=0.01).
gof_tests.ad_pass: The fitted distribution is consistent with the observed data, including tails.
gof_tests.ad_moderate: Moderate evidence of poor fit, especially in the tails.
gof_tests.ad_strong: Strong evidence of poor fit, particularly in distribution tails.
gof_tests.chisq_pass: The observed frequencies match the expected frequencies from the fitted distribution.
gof_tests.chisq_moderate: Moderate discrepancy between observed and expected frequencies.
gof_tests.chisq_strong: Significant discrepancy between observed and expected frequencies.
gof_tests.cvm_pass: The fitted distribution shows good overall agreement with the data.
gof_tests.cvm_moderate: Moderate overall discrepancy between fitted distribution and data.
gof_tests.cvm_strong: Significant overall discrepancy between fitted distribution and data.

errors.insufficient_data: Data must contain at least 2 non-missing observations
errors.invalid_fit_object: Object must be a distfitr_fit object
